DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable response regarding whether the patient has an unresolved toxicity from previous anti-cancer therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite) and having been present before a specific date or event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Having been present before a specific date or event.

Concepts.definition: Having been present before a specific date or event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have unresolved
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicity from previous anti-cancer therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicity (NCI CTCAE v4.0) grade 2 or higher from previous anti-cancer therapy, except alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to at least less than or equal to grade 2 clinically significant adverse effect(s)/toxicity (ies) of the previous therapy, with the exception of alopecia, unless approved by the Prinicpal Investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicity National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, version 4.0 (NCI CTCAE v4.0) grade 2 or higher from previous anti-cancer therapy, except alopecia, at the time of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to grade 1 or less (except alopecia) from prior treatment related toxicities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any ongoing toxicities greater than or equal to grade 2 from prior therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any ongoing toxicities greater than or equal to grade 1 from prior therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have unresolved toxicity higher than CTCAE Grade 1 attributed to any prior therapy/procedure, excluding alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any acute, clinically significant treatment-related toxicity from prior therapy, except for alopecia, that have not resolved to Grade less than or equal to 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover to grade 1 or less from any adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier (excluding alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than CTCAE Grade 1 or baseline, with the exception of alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicity of National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, version 4.0 (NCI CTCAE v4.0) grade 2 or higher from previous anti-cancer therapy, except alopecia, at the time of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have persistent toxicities caused by previous cancer therapy;  toxicities have recovered to less than or equal to grade 1, excluding alopecia and stable chronic grade 2 toxicity that is not overlapping with presumed toxicities of Olaparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any unresolved toxicity of NCI CTCAE v5.0 grade 2 or higher from previous anticancer therapy, except alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have persistent grade greater than 1 CTCAE version 4.0 adverse events (except alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have persistent toxicities (greater than CTCAE grade 2) caused by previous cancer therapy, excluding alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have persistent toxicities (greater than or equal to CTCAE grade 2) with the exception of alopecia, caused by previous cancer therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any unresolved toxicity NCI CTCAE Grade greater than or equal to 2 from previous anticancer therapy with the exception of alopecia, vitiligo, and the laboratory values defined in the inclusion criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicity National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, version 5.0 (NCI CTCAE v5.0) grade 2 or higher from previous anti-cancer therapy, except alopecia, at the time of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any unresolved toxicities NCI CTCAE Grade 2 or higher from previous anticancer therapy (with the exception of those allowed in section 3.3 of the protocol)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicity National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, version 5.0 (NCI CTCAE v5.0) grade 2 or higher from previous anti-cancer therapy, except alopecia, or an endocrine toxicity related to immunotherapy (e.g. thyroiditis/hypothyroidism, adrenal insufficiency, hypophysitis) requiring replacement therapy, at the time of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have persistent grade greater than 1 CTCAE version 5.0 adverse events (except alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex- 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any ongoing toxicities greater than or equal to grade 2 from prior therapy, except those related to hydroxyurea (which is permitted through the first 5 days of study treatment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have persistent toxicities (CTCAE grade 2) caused by previous cancer therapy, excluding alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicities from previous anticancer therapy, defined as toxicities (other than alopecia) not yet resolved to Grade less than or equal to 1 or baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have persistent toxicity greater than grade 1 from prior cancer therapy (except alopecia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have unresolved toxicities from previous anticancer therapy, defined as toxicities (other than alopecia) not yet resolved to less than or equal to Grade 1 or baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have unresolved chronic toxicity with CTCAE grade greater than or equal to 2 from previous anti-neoplastic therapy, except for alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any unresolved toxicities NCI CTCAE Grade 2 or higher from previous anticancer therapy (with the exception of those allowed in section 3.2 of the protocol)?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.28 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002221. ak
